alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 5:11PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. .Warm temperatures continue to melt high mountain snowpack. The river is currently just below flood stage, and expected to continue to recede over the coming days. For the Lower Humboldt...including Battle Mountain...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Localized minor lowland flooding along the reach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 8.5 feet early Thursday morning. - Action stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
